page.title: 03CLUB DAY,THE FAIR,SHRIMPING.
page.content: {Lytham Pier}was constructed in 1861 at a cost of{Â£6,000.}It was 914 feet in length.In 1960 it was decided tha it wae a danger to the public and should be demolished.A fighting committee tried desperately to keep the pier.However, in March 1960 demolition work commenced.Much of the timber was used locally for firewood. Lytham used to be famous for{ {shrimping}now it is not.Recently there has been a campaign to clean up the sea to attract more shrimps back. In the 19th Century families all got together after a catch and they shelled,boiled and potted them in butter.Once there were few shrimps caught for 2 years and it was thought that they had gone for good.However, catches are now on the increase and 7 boats are now working out of Lytham.
